pr_title: Model refactoring, Memory Leak prevention, UTF-8 encoding

timeline.body:
I'm OK with the changes, but this change will probably not fix memory leaks since the close method of a `ByteArrayInputStream` doesn't do anything:

```java
    /**
     * Closing a {@code ByteArrayInputStream} has no effect. The methods in
     * this class can be called after the stream has been closed without
     * generating an {@code IOException}.
     */
    public void close() throws IOException {
    }
```

It's just an `InputStream` backed by a byte array that doesn't hold any other resources besides the array and a few variables. It doesn't hurt to always use try-with-resources to prevent issues, but it's only really required for a few Stream implementations.
